episodes.synopsis: Using the example of the popular teddy bear toy, Jon Mooallem shows how the stories we tell about wild animals affect a species' chance of survival.
episodes.title: Jon Mooallem: How the Teddy Bear Taught Us Compassion

episodes.synopsis: Laurel Braitman asks what we can learn about people by watching animals cope with depression, sadness and other mental health problems.
episodes.title: Laurel Braitman: Depressed Dogs, Cats with OCD - What Animal Madness Means for Us Humans

episodes.synopsis: Through his photographs of animals, Frans Lanting asks us to recognize our connectedness with all other creatures on Earth.
episodes.title: Frans Lanting: Photos That Give Voice to the Animal Kingdom

episodes.synopsis: Cardiologist Barbara Natterson-Horowitz suggests that human health care can be improved by studying the evolutionary links between people and animals.
episodes.title: Barbara Natterson-Horowitz: What Veterinarians Know That Physicians Don't

episodes.synopsis: Nicolas Perony reveals how individual animal behaviors collectively form complex patterns that can help the group adapt to changing circumstances.
episodes.title: Nicolas Perony: Puppies! Now That I’ve Got Your Attention, Complexity Theory

episodes.synopsis: Sound recordist Bernie Krause reveals what nature's sounds, from bird songs to the calls of a grieving beaver, can teach us about the environment.
episodes.title: Bernie Krause: The Voice of the Natural World

episodes.synopsis: According to Frans de Waal, results of behavioral tests on primates and other mammals demonstrate that certain moral traits are not limited to humans.
episodes.title: Frans de Waal: Moral Behavior in Animals

episodes.synopsis: After 28 years studying a pod of dolphins, Denise Herzing wonders if their communication can be considered language and if so, can humans learn it.
episodes.title: Denise Herzing: Could We Speak the Language of Dolphins?

video.title: TEDTalks: Animal Voices
video.synopsis: Peer inside the minds of animals to gain understanding of their behavior and mental health, as well as the impact humans play in their well-being.
